data.title: Meh... Date Decor and Marginal Food
data.text: It's a shame to watch this storied restaurant age over time.  Unlike most, it did not age gracefully.  You're stuck in a 90s time warp.  Foodwise, you might as well back up a cisco truck.  Nothing unique nor amazing to discuss.

owner_response.author: Ed_Sylcox, General Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback. I always love the opportunity to discuss are plans to upgrade this lovely hotel. I agree that the French Mediterranean design might not fit the modern look of most restaurants but our loyal guests that remember getting married here or remember visiting Cleveland for the first love the fact the restaurant hasn't lost it's character. When we upgrade the restaurant and the rest of the hotel we will be keeping the historic look but upgrading the items from floor to ceiling. I think you will really enjoy our face lift.
Look forward to your return visit once we are finished with everything.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Breakfast Buffet
data.text: This buffet was very nice each morning. The servants were very nice and willing to help. There was a nice variety of breakfast items.

data.title: Maybe it was just a bad afternoon .....
data.text: I like being positive with reviews and find it a bit difficult to write negative reviews as it based on a one time experience in most cases . However when staff and service are up to par I find it easier to simply alert folks to food mediocrity. Price should equal quality and in this case it was not . Staff was quick to respond  so I suspect the chef may have had one of those days  The steak was served as "rare as possible and it was barely pink so there was no quibble and it was replaced promptly .

owner_response.author: Ed_Sylcox, General Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear nosbigs, Thank you for your feedback!  I can certainly understand the disappointment you may have felt when your steak wasn't initially prepared as you requested.  I am so pleased that we quickly and without question provided you with a replacement!  We would love to have you back as our guest.  We have live music four days a week and some fantastic specials!  We are certain your next visit will earn us a 5 star review! Sincerely, Ed S., Hotel Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A very nice place for breakfast
data.text: This restaurant is attached to the Renaissance Cleveland hotel and is only open for breakfast.  Best option is to get the buffet - which runs about $20 with tax and modest tip.  Food and service were exceptionally good.

data.title: Cleveland's Best
data.text: A fabulous dining experience, a true gastronomical delight.  The chef does not disappoint.  Can't wait to return.

data.title: Nice view and great food
data.text: This is highly under rated here in Cleveland. It has an amazing view of public square. They used to have a great lobster pasta and a have a great salmon wrap!

data.title: Breakfast and Lunch were very good
data.text: Cannot comment about dinner bur Buffet or a la carte breakfast options, good, simple luncheon menu, excellent service

data.title: Customized menu for you.
data.text: The food and service here was really good.  I had some dietary needs and they created a dish for me.  They also did for me in room as well, big help for me.  Maurice in the restaurant and bar, is an awesome employee, as well as Alba another server in the restaurant.

owner_response.author: Steve G, General Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear Deniseka, Thank you!  We love receiving positive feedback regarding our ambassadors and the outstanding service they provide! It was a pleasure to have you as our guest!  We look forward to your next stay.  Sincerely, Steve G., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Stay there but never ate ,but do like the food from room service,i think one would joy it
data.text: I think anyone coming from out of town or in town would in join the the whole beautiful art scene on the walls and the food from the kitchen was good for room service.

owner_response.author: Steve G, General Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear 920berthag, Thank you for your review and for the recommendation.  We would love to have you back and for you to experience the wonderful food prepared by our culinary team.  We are certain you would enjoy it.  Sincerely, Steve G., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Business lunch
data.text: Had been here previously and knew it was good.  Took two friends for a business lunch.  They enjoyed their lunch a lot.  Be sure to get the “Clevelandian”.  Braised pork cheeks.  To die for, I assure you.

owner_response.author: Steve G, General Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear LynnMedina, We really appreciate your business and your review of our Sans Souci Restaurant!  The "Clevelandian" is one of my favorites too!  We are about add a few items to the menu including "Black Pepper & Basil Angel Hair with lobster cream sauce" and a   "Braised Lamb Shank" which are amazing!  We hope you are able to return soon to check it out.  Sincerely, Steve G., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A former favorite now DESTROYED! Very disappointed
data.text: Went there tonight, first time in a long time for dinner. Had the mezze, appetizer, and the polish boy burger, wife had the chicken noodle soup, pork cheek appetizer and smoked pork chop, Problems: wife ordered the pork grackle, not the pork cheeks, server argued about it and just would not accept that we had the wrong dish, I asked for medium well on the burger, it came back as charcoal, completely burnt. The thin slices of kolabasi on top were Ok, but the overall burger combination with fries on it and what tasted like cattleman sauce was overall not worth the money. The pork chop came with some kind of greens that were so salty they were inedible. I have no idea how you can screw up mac and cheese, this was the other pork chop side, but it was terrible. I sat there with an empty soft drink glass for a long long time. I only saw one server on duty, she did not come back after the food was dropped off for a long long time, heck we were done when she came back, then I asked for a check and she came back 15 minutes later and said, can I do anything for you, I said, yeah, remember me, I asked for a check a long time ago. No manager came around and asked how we were doing. The place was not even that busy. This used to be a classy nice place that was sort of higher end. I was happy to pay whatever it was because there was great service and great food. This cost me $92 with 15% tip and it was frankly just terrible. W should have gone to the food court at tower city, would have gotten a similar meal for $25 for both of us. One observation is that the menu has been changed. It is now basically dumbed down with 4 different kinds of burgers. I am of the opinion is now lower class, and some genius is now trying to cheapen things to make money. I am no longer a fan and am disappointed.

owner_response.author: Steve G, General Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear cometman, Thank you for your review.  Please accept our apologies for the disappointing experience.  We take your feedback to heart and have addressed the food and service shortcomings.  We are in the process of updating our menu and are excited to be bringing back some classic Sans Souci items. We do hope you try the restaurant again in the future.  We are certain both the execution and product will live up to your expectations. Sincerely, Steve G., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Perfect Holiday Dinner!
data.text:
Eight of us had Christmas dinner at San Souci and it was perfect. Christmas is a traditional holiday and San Sauci compliments that sense of tradition. Our waiter was Sean and he provided impeccable service. He was always there when we needed him but otherwise was not intrusive. 
We had a very nice Proseco to start the meal, The lobster bisque was flavorful and fresh, my mushrooms in pastry was lovely and the calamari was plentiful. For entries we had steak cooked to perfection with fluffy mashed potatoes and asparagus, salmon with risotto, and rack of lamb cooked just right.
We were there for three hours and never once felt rushed. We could carry on a conversation without the din of most other restaurants. If you want a quiet meal with good and carefully prepared food with excellent service, I would highly recommend San Sauci.

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Greetings and thank you so much for choosing to spend another holiday with us and also for taking your time to post.  We sincerely appreciate the kind words and we wish you a very Happy New Year!  Please visit us again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Supposed to be a great celebration venue
data.text:
Our 35th wedding anniversary. It was supposed to be a special night.  Got another couple to go along. We one of two tabes, dark, incomprehensible menu. Just did not feel right.  WE HAD TO LEAVE. 
I remember when it was a great dining adventure. To bad it went so far down hill.

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Andrew and please accept our sincere apologies for your entire anniversary situation.  Our general manager would very much like the opportunity to speak with you about your experience.  Should you have a moment, we hope that you will please email us at rencleveland@renaissancehotels.com with details and contact information so that we may have him contact you.  Once again, we are so terribly sorry.  Happy Anniversary to you both.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Outstanding food and service
data.text:
My husband and I have been coming to this restaurant for years to celebrate our anniversary and we have never been disappointed. The menus have changed over the years and accommodate meat, fish and vegetarian preference. The prices are very fair and given the quality and careful preparation modest. The only concern I hav was that the restaurant was nearly empty on a Saturday night. This is a shame, because you are missing out on great food to reasonable price in a lovely setting.

This place is a hidden gem and I'm looking forward to the time public square will be redone and the views will be stunning.

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Winterhude and thank you so very much for taking the time to post about your experience at Sans Souci.  We certainly appreciate the wonderful feedback and will be sure to share with our general manager and executive chef.  Once again, we thank you for visiting and we hope you'll be dining with us again very soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Convention
data.text: Had several meals there along with the breakfast buffet.  Food was very good and the service was excellent...very personable wait staff!

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Jim and thank you so much for the wonderful five stars.  We're happy to hear that you enjoyed and we look forward to seeing you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text: I had the fish tacos and they were amazing.  Served with a nice slaw that made them all the more perfect.

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Beth and thank you so much for taking the time to post about your lunch!  We love seeing the glowing five stars and we're very happy the fish tacos were to your liking.  Once again, we thank you for dining with us and we hope you'll return again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: If you are okay with room service...
data.text:
We went to Sans Souci for a celebratory retirement dinner. We used to live in Cleveland and Sans Souci was a special place for special dinners. The Mediterranean French cuisine was rich and wonderful. Last night... No cuisine available befitting its name. We decided to order the filet, which was a better selection for a celebration than a burger or fish and chips.

What we got tasted like partially cooked and then microwaved. Had a stomach ache all night. Such a disappointment for a beautiful place with a great view of Public Square.

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Angela and thank you very much for taking your time to post about your experience at Sans Souci.  We are terribly, terribly sorry for disappointment upon returning.  We actually just welcomed a new chef on board who will be revising our entire menu and going back to the Mediterranean style of cooking that so many guests liked.  If you have a moment, please email us at rencleveland@renaissancehotels.com and include details about your meal as well as contact information so that we may forward to our general manager.  We are truly sorry and we'll be looking for your email.  Thank you again for posting.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good dining with a view
data.text: The service and food was excellent.  Price as expected was high for a downtown restaurant.  The view of public square was excellent.  The waiter was attentive without being obtrusive.  I recommend the smoked pork chop.  The dining atmosphere was very pleasant.

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Greetings Daniel and thank you so much for taking the time to post about your experience at Sans Souci.  We very much appreciate the kinds words and we have passed them directly to our general manager to share with our team.  Thank you again for visiting!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quiet, calm, good food and wonderful ambience.
data.text: We had a lovely evening with friends at San Souci in an atmosphere of calm.  In contrast to most modern restaurants, San Souci has an ambiance that lends itself to good conversation over good wine and good food. The table had a view of the renovations of our Public Square which will be magnificent when it is finished. We were able to linger and catch up on each other's lives. The service was excellent and while we all chose steaks and fish, common to most restaurants, it was prepared to our specifications. We all had dessert. The cheesecake and almond cake both, were light and delicious.  It was such a pleasure not to shout just to have a conversation that we will be back.

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Greetings and thank you very much for taking the time to post about your experience at Sans Souci.  We are thrilled to hear that everything was to your liking and that you plan on returning.  Until then, safe travels.  Thank you once again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Breakfast overlooking public square is a treat.
data.text: If your stay at the classic Renaissance Hotel includes breakfast, you will enjoy this beautiful restaurant on the weekends.

owner_response.author: Ami W, Guest Relations Manager at Sans Souci, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Joseph and thank you for choosing to dine with us at Sans Souci - we definitely appreciate your kind words about breakfast and we hope to see you again very soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
